URF Syndra: http://kdjay.co.uk/store/media/catalog/product/cache/1/image/9df78eab33525d08d6e5fb8d27136e95/p/l/playballs1_1_1_1.jpg
After rework the second will be Normal. :D
Yeah, with all the great mana regen items after the MYMU {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

You mean tear which single handedly is sustaining every mage because of all the ludicrous amounts of flat mana everyone is getting and the 25% refund on spellcasts + meditation and blue buff scaling harder the more mana you have? Or the 1% missing mana regeneration per second of the water dragon?

Tear is an item not all champions want to go because it makes early to mid game weaker. Taking meditation is a trade off only mages need to take while Marksmen get Essence Reaver and still get good stats and mana sustain. And getting the water dragon is not a certainty, same with blue.

On the PBE currently, pretty much every mid mage with mana is buying tear like mages used to get chalice back in its heyday. You get it early to provide sustain while deferring your power towards mid game when you can 1st Item + Archangel's spike. Yes, it is definitely pigeonholing mage builds on the PBE atm, but it's also a great source of mana that provide some insane mana sustain in conjunction with the multiple neutral objectives your team needs to contest. 

You're totally right about Meditation being forced though.

When I get 15 down votes for only saying "The funny part is Azirs soldiers are capped at 3 on urf. Where on live you can get a max of 4." and then he calls me out and gets 15 up votes saying "It concerns me that you are an azir main but you think you can get 4 soldiers...". Yeah I'm gonna flame the kid, not only is he wrong but he's way out of place to call out one of the most experienced Azir players in the world

Wait, tree bombing is a thing?
Why are we not doing that?!?!???

1- $$$
2- Finding land to do it is probably difficult
3- I'm guessing as of now the effectiveness is fairly limited

Basically it's probably like Cloud Seeding, possible but not economically viable.
We attempt to seed the clouds every year in California.

That last picture just makes me really sad {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}

It's all fun to pick cool champion and spam skills in URF, until cancer  like Zed, Fizz or Wukong comes and kills you in  2 seconds, while you can't do anything to them. 
That's how 90% of my URFs look like. It's fun, until enemy cancer leaves his lane and starts ganking. Then you stop playing and just watch 40s grey screens.
